messages: 75e263bbaf994a9388203c0456a248f0 (06:18): i mean for ex, if i moves rotate/scale a cube around?
f4daaee3493fc00072e5da3f366142be (06:24): does anyone have any good tips for animating complex characters?
fd7a021eecc76bc977eb442336fe5132 (06:32): greetings!   how do you tell an object to rotate base on the global/world corrdinates? i am having trouble rotating the camera to exact angle.
f4daaee3493fc00072e5da3f366142be (06:34): nbjayme: are you trying to rotate the camera around its center along the Z axis?

fd7a021eecc76bc977eb442336fe5132 (06:38): i can rotate the camera base on it's own axis. i want to rotate camera base on global axis (angle). for example, 30 degrees not from the camera relative axis but the global axis. (sorry, if it's a bit confusing).

f4daaee3493fc00072e5da3f366142be (06:41): well, if you put the 3d cursor in the center of the scene (where the x,y,z coordinates meet) and then select the camera and click "center new" you can then rotate the camera around its new center of rotation
